SE450: Subclassing: Designing for Delegation [3/35]

file:util/SubscriptionsTEST.java [source] [doc-public] [doc-private]
00001: package util;
00002: 
00003: import junit.framework.Assert;
00004: import junit.framework.TestCase;
00005: 
00006: public class SubscriptionsTEST extends TestCase {
00007:   private static class Counter {
00008:     private Subscriptions<Counter,String> _oh = new Subscriptions<Counter,String>(this);
00009:     public void addSubscriber(Subscriber<Counter,String> subscriber) {
00010:       _oh.addSubscriber(subscriber);
00011:     }
00012:     public void notifySubscribers(String data) {
00013:       _oh.notifySubscribers(data);
00014:     }
00015:     
00016:     int _j;
00017:     public int get() {
00018:       return _j;
00019:     }
00020:     public void inc() {
00021:       _j++;
00022:       _oh.setChanged();
00023:     }
00024:     public String toString() {
00025:       return "Counter(" + _j + ")";
00026:     }
00027:   }
00028: 
00029:   public SubscriptionsTEST(String name) {
00030:     super(name);
00031:   }
00032:   public void testA () {
00033:     Counter c = new Counter();
00034:     c.addSubscriber(new Subscriber<Counter,String>() {
00035:       public void update(Counter sender, String data) {
00036:         System.out.println ("update(" + sender + "," + data + ")");
00037:       }});
00038:     c.inc();
00039:     c.inc();
00040:     c.notifySubscribers("Dog");
00041:   }
00042:   private String output;
00043:   public void testB () {
00044:     Counter c = new Counter();
00045:     c.addSubscriber(new Subscriber<Counter,String>() {
00046:       public void update(Counter sender, String data) {
00047:         output = ("update(" + sender + "," + data + ")");
00048:       }});
00049:     c.inc();
00050:     c.inc();
00051:     c.notifySubscribers("Dog");
00052:     Assert.assertEquals("update(Counter(2),Dog)",output);
00053:   }
00054: }

file:util/Subscriber.java [source] [doc-public] [doc-private]
00001: package util;
00002: /**
00003:  * A generic subscriber which a class can implement when it wants to be informed
00004:  * of changes in published objects.
00005:  * 
00006:  * @param <T> the type of the publisher object
00007:  * @param <U> the type of the optional data argument
00008:  * @see Subscriptions
00009:  */
00010: public interface Subscriber<T, U> {
00011:   /**
00012:    * This method is called whenever the published object is changed.
00013:    * 
00014:    * @param publisher the object which was the source of the notification.
00015:    * @param data an optional data parameter which encapsulates any
00016:    *   additional data about the event
00017:    */
00018:   void update(T publisher, U data);
00019: }
00020:

file:util/Subscriptions.java [source] [doc-public] [doc-private]
00001: package util;
00002: import java.util.ArrayList;
00003: import java.util.List;
00004: 
00005: /**
00006:  * A helper class which can be used to manage an object's subscriptions.
00007:  * 
00008:  * @param <T> the type of the publisher
00009:  * @param <U> the type of the optional data argument
00010:  * @see Subscriber
00011:  */
00012: public final class Subscriptions<T, U> {
00013:         private final T publisher;
00014:         private final List<Subscriber<T, U>> subscribers;
00015:         private boolean changed = false;
00016: 
00017:         /**
00018:          * Initializes a new instance of the {@link Subscriptions} class with
00019:          * zero subscribers.
00020:          * 
00021:          * @param publisher the object being publisher
00022:          * @throws IllegalArgumentException if publisher is <code>null</code>
00023:          */
00024:         public Subscriptions(T publisher) {
00025:                 if (publisher == null)
00026:                         throw new IllegalArgumentException("publisher cannot be null");
00027:                 this.publisher = publisher;
00028:                 this.subscribers = new ArrayList<Subscriber<T, U>>();
00029:         }
00030: 
00031:         /**
00032:          * Adds an subscriber to the set of subscribers for the publisher object,
00033:          * provided that it is not the same as some subscriber already in the set.
00034:          * 
00035:          * @param subscriber
00036:          * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the parameter subscriber is <code>null</code>
00037:          */
00038:         public void addSubscriber(Subscriber<T, U> subscriber) {
00039:                 if (subscriber == null)
00040:                         throw new IllegalArgumentException("subscriber cannot be null");
00041:                 if (!subscribers.contains(subscriber)) {
00042:                         subscribers.add(subscriber);
00043:                 }
00044:         }
00045: 
00046:         /**
00047:          * Indicates that the publisher object has no longer changed, or that it has
00048:          * already notified all of its subscribers of its most recent change, so that
00049:          * {@link #hasChanged()} will now return <code>false</code>. This method
00050:          * is called automatically by the {@link #notifySubscribers} methods.
00051:          * 
00052:          */
00053:         public void clearChanged() {
00054:                 changed = false;
00055:         }
00056: 
00057:         /**
00058:          * Returns the number of subscribers of publisher object.
00059:          * 
00060:          * @return the number of subscribers of publisher object
00061:          */
00062:         public int countSubscribers() {
00063:                 return subscribers.size();
00064:         }
00065: 
00066:         /**
00067:          * Deletes an subscriber from the set of subscribers. Passing <code>null</code>
00068:          * to this method will have no effect.
00069:          * 
00070:          * @param subscriber the {@link Subscriber} to be deleted
00071:          */
00072:         public void deleteSubscriber(Subscriber<T, U> subscriber) {
00073:                 subscribers.remove(subscriber);
00074:         }
00075: 
00076:         /**
00077:          * Clears the subscriber list so that the publisher object no longer has any
00078:          * subscribers.
00079:          */
00080:         public void deleteSubscribers() {
00081:                 this.subscribers.clear();
00082:         }
00083: 
00084:         /**
00085:          * Returns <code>true</code> if the publisher object has changed;
00086:          * otherwise, <code>false</code>.
00087:          * 
00088:          * @return <code>true</code> if the publisher object has changed;
00089:          *         otherwise, <code>false</code>
00090:          */
00091:         public boolean hasChanged() {
00092:                 return changed;
00093:         }
00094: 
00095:         /**
00096:          * If this object has changed, as indicated by the {@link #hasChanged()},
00097:          * then notify all of its subscribers and then clear the changed state. This
00098:          * method is equivalent to calling <code>notifySubscribers(null)</code>.
00099:          */
00100:         public void notifySubscribers() {
00101:                 notifySubscribers(null);
00102:         }
00103: 
00104:         /**
00105:          * If this object has changed, as indicated by the {@link #hasChanged()},
00106:          * then notify all of its subscribers and then clear the changed state.
00107:          * 
00108:          * @param data optional event specific data which will be passed to the subscribers
00109:          */
00110:         public void notifySubscribers(U data) {
00111:                 if (hasChanged()) {
00112:                         for (Subscriber<T, U> subscriber : subscribers) {
00113:                                 subscriber.update(publisher, data);
00114:                         }
00115:                         clearChanged();
00116:                 }
00117:         }
00118: 
00119:         /**
00120:          * Flags the publisher object as having changed.
00121:          */
00122:         public void setChanged() {
00123:                 changed = true;
00124:         }
00125: }
00126:

Disadvantage of subclassing in Java: must export interface of superclass.

Advantage of subclassing in Java: syntactically light, easy to share fields.
